description: Understand the principles of differentiation
Apply differentiation to find gradients and turning points
Understand and use the chain rule
Understand the concept of integration as the reverse of differentiation
Calculate definite and indefinite integrals
Use integration to find the area under a curve
Work with vectors in 2D and 3D
Calculate the scalar product of two vectors
Explore limits of functions and continuity
Define the derivative of a function and use it to solve problems
Understand the meaning of the definite integral as a limit of Riemann sums
Apply the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
Analyze vector-valued functions
Solve problems involving motion in a plane
Master the formal definition of limits and continuity (epsilon-delta)
Compute derivatives of elementary and composite functions
Apply derivatives to optimization and related rates problems
Define the Riemann integral and its properties
Evaluate integrals using various techniques, including substitution and integration by parts
Perform vector operations, including dot and cross products
Analyze curves and surfaces in 3D space using vector calculus
Understand and apply Green's, Stokes', and Divergence theorems
